p: Volatile aldehydes, also a chemical class formed by the lipoxygenase pathway from fatty acids [ 139, 149], are well-known for their green note odour. ( E)-2-nonenal and ( Z)-3-hexenal ( Figure 12), despite their different structures, also originate from different fatty acids (( E)-2-nonenal, from linoleic acid and ( Z)-3-hexenal from linolenic acid) and are described as presenting other sensory attributes. “Penetrating”, “waxy” [ 150] or “fatty” [ 152] characteristics have been linked to ( E)-2-nonenal, while, for ( Z)-3-hexenal, “leafy”, “powerful”, “strawberry leaf”, “winey”, “green leaves”, “apple-like”, “leaf-like” and “cut grass” attributes have also been linked.
